research_groups.title: Human‑Centered Computing Lab
research_groups.description: Interdisciplinary research on socio-technical systems, network analysis, NLP, machine learning, and responsible computing.

research_groups.title: Chair of Human‑Centered Technologies for Learning (HCTL)
research_groups.description: Focus on human-centered AI in education, user modeling, adaptive multimodal systems, and immersive learning.

research_groups.title: Institute for Cognitive Systems (ICS)
research_groups.description: Research on biologically inspired cognitive architectures, machine learning, and human-like reasoning for systems that interact naturally with humans.

research_groups.title: Human‑Centered Engineering, Department of Computer Engineering
research_groups.description: Design and development of interactive systems, recommender services, social computing, and context-aware user-centric applications.

research_groups.title: HEX‑Lab (Human‑Centered Computing & Extended Reality)
research_groups.description: Lab focused on HCI, AI, extended reality (XR), robotics, and assistive systems for medicine and interactive environments.

research_groups.title: Chair of Information‑Oriented Control (ITR)
research_groups.description: Research on human-centric control theory, personalised machine learning, adaptive systems, and human-machine collaboration in control applications.

research_groups.title: Human‑Centered Neuroengineering (TUM‑IAS Focus Group)
research_groups.description: Focuses on neuro-inspired robotics, sensory-motor integration, human perception and cognition for intelligent prosthetics and robot systems.

research_groups.title: Human-Centered Ubiquitous Media Group (HCM)
research_groups.description: Research at the intersection of human-computer interaction, ubiquitous computing, media technology, and human augmentation; focuses on amplifying human abilities through AI and digital technologies, human-AI collaboration, and interactive systems.

research_groups.title: Media Informatics Group
research_groups.description: Explores human-computer interaction, interactive systems, usable security, public displays, and AI-supported interfaces; strong emphasis on human-centered design and evaluation of interactive AI technologies.

research_groups.title: Technology and Research on Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (TRAIL)
research_groups.description: Investigates AI and machine learning with focus on recommender systems, multi-agent systems, human-AI social interaction, affective computing, and empathic AI.

research_groups.title: Munich AI & Natural Language Processing Lab (MaiNLP)
research_groups.description: Human-facing NLP research making models more robust, inclusive, fair, and capable of handling language variation; focuses on human-AI interaction through language technologies.

research_groups.title: MCML Junior Research Group Human-Centered NLP
research_groups.description: Research at the intersection of NLP, machine learning, and human-computer interaction; addresses human factors in AI development, low-resource scenarios, and controllable models.

research_groups.title: Social Data Science and AI Lab (SODA)
research_groups.description: Examines societal implications of AI, machine learning fairness, bias, and human-centered aspects of data-driven technologies.

research_groups.title: Chair of Computational Modeling in Psychology
research_groups.description: Develops formal computational models of human cognition, decision-making, reasoning, and learning; bridges cognitive science and AI with focus on human behavior modeling.

research_groups.title: Human-Computer Interaction Lab
research_groups.description: Research on ubiquitous and wearable computing, mixed reality, tangible interaction, and human-centered design of interactive AI systems.

research_groups.title: Quality and Usability Lab
research_groups.description: Focuses on human perception, emotion modeling, speech and multimodal interaction, quality of experience, and affective computing in human-AI and human-technology interaction.

research_groups.title: Distributed Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (DAI-Labor)
research_groups.description: Develops distributed and multi-agent AI systems with emphasis on smart services, personalization, recommender systems, human-AI collaboration, and intelligent assistants.

research_groups.title: Berlin Ethics Lab for Responsible AI and Human-Machine Interaction
research_groups.description: Interdisciplinary lab addressing ethical, societal, and philosophical challenges of AI and robotics, focusing on responsible human-centered and human-AI interaction.

research_groups.title: BRAINS, MINDS and BOTS Lab (Cognition and Cooperation in Human-Technology Interaction)
research_groups.description: Investigates attribution of mental states to AI and robots (mind perception), trust, cooperation, and neurophysiological correlates of human-AI interaction using EEG and fNIRS.

research_groups.title: Service-centric Networking – Smart Cities and Recommendation Systems Group
research_groups.description: Research on decentralized and privacy-preserving recommender systems, user modeling, personalization in smart environments, and human-centered aspects of recommendation technologies.

research_groups.title: Human-Centered Ubiquitous Media Group (HCM)
research_groups.description: Research at the intersection of human-computer interaction, ubiquitous computing, media technology, and human augmentation; focuses on amplifying human abilities through AI and digital technologies, human-AI collaboration, and interactive systems.

research_groups.title: Media Informatics Group
research_groups.description: Explores human-computer interaction, interactive systems, usable security, public displays, and AI-supported interfaces; strong emphasis on human-centered design and evaluation of interactive AI technologies.

research_groups.title: Technology and Research on Artificial Intelligence Laboratory (TRAIL)
research_groups.description: Investigates AI and machine learning with focus on recommender systems, multi-agent systems, human-AI social interaction, affective computing, and empathic AI.

research_groups.title: Munich AI & Natural Language Processing Lab (MaiNLP)
research_groups.description: Human-facing NLP research making models more robust, inclusive, fair, and capable of handling language variation; focuses on human-AI interaction through language technologies.

research_groups.title: MCML Junior Research Group Human-Centered NLP
research_groups.description: Research at the intersection of NLP, machine learning and human-computer interaction; addresses human factors in AI development, low-resource scenarios, and controllable models.

research_groups.title: Social Data Science and AI Lab (SODA)
research_groups.description: Examines societal implications of AI, machine learning fairness, bias, and human-centered aspects of data-driven technologies.

research_groups.title: Chair of Computational Modeling in Psychology
research_groups.description: Develops formal computational models of human cognition, decision-making, reasoning, and learning; bridges cognitive science and AI with strong focus on modeling human behavior.

research_groups.title: Media Computing Group (HCI Group)
research_groups.description: Leading Human-Computer Interaction research group focusing on post-desktop interfaces, tangible, wearable, ubiquitous and mixed reality systems, physical computing, personal fabrication, and human-centered design of interactive AI technologies.

research_groups.title: Human-Computer Interaction Center (HCIC)
research_groups.description: Interdisciplinary central institute integrating HCI, usability engineering, human-AI interaction, technology acceptance, and user-centered design across computer science, psychology, and communication studies.

research_groups.title: Chair of Artificial Intelligence Methodology (AIM)
research_groups.description: Dedicated to methodological advances in human-centred AI, including automated machine learning, explainable AI, and responsible AI systems that augment human capabilities.

research_groups.title: Learning Technologies Research Group
research_groups.description: Research on technology-enhanced learning, intelligent tutoring systems, recommender systems in education, personalization, and human-centered aspects of adaptive learning environments.

research_groups.title: Chair for Computational Social Sciences and Humanities (CSSH)
research_groups.description: Uses computational methods, machine learning, and big data to model human behavior, social dynamics, opinion formation, and socio-technical systems.

research_groups.title: Chair of Communication Science / Human-Computer Interaction in Aging Society
research_groups.description: Focuses on human-computer interaction with emphasis on aging, health recommender systems, affective computing elements, acceptance of AI, and human factors in socio-technical systems.

research_groups.title: Human-Centered Systems Lab (h-lab) – Information Systems I (Prof. Alexander Mädche)
research_groups.description: Designs interactive intelligent systems using human-centered AI; focuses on personalization, explainable AI, conversational agents, affective computing, NeuroIS, and biosignal-based adaptation for productivity and well-being.

research_groups.title: Computer Vision for Human-Computer Interaction Lab (CV:HCI)
research_groups.description: Develops perceptive multimodal interfaces using computer vision; applications in human-robot interaction, smart environments, assistive technology for visually impaired, and human-aware AI systems.

research_groups.title: Human-Computer Interaction and Accessibility Group (Prof. Katharina Gerling)
research_groups.description: Explores accessible interactive technologies, games for health, participatory design with disabled users, and human-centered evaluation of AI-supported assistive systems.

research_groups.title: High-Performance Humanoid Technologies Lab (H2T)
research_groups.description: Develops humanoid robots with focus on human-robot collaboration, learning from demonstration, grasping, manipulation, and human-aware cognitive architectures.

research_groups.title: Interactive Systems Lab (ISL)

research_groups.title: Pervasive Computing Systems Group (TECO)
research_groups.description: Research on wearable computing, haptic interfaces, affective computing with wearables, context-aware systems, and human-centered pervasive AI applications.

research_groups.title: Ubiquitous Knowledge Processing Lab (UKP-TUDa) – Prof. Iryna Gurevych

research_groups.title: Intelligent Autonomous Systems Lab (IAS) – Prof. Jan Peters

research_groups.title: Telecooperation Lab (TK) – Prof. Max Mühlhäuser

research_groups.title: Centre for Cognitive Science – Cognitive Psychology & Human-AI Interaction

research_groups.title: Adaptive Recommender Systems Group – Prof. Ulf Brefeld

research_groups.title: Neuropsychology of Action & Action Observation Lab

research_groups.title: AI*MAN Lab – Transparent & Traceable AI in Human-AI Teamwork
research_groups.description: Part of the TU Delft AI Labs programme; develops methodologies for effective human-AI teaming with emphasis on mutual understanding, transparency, traceability, shared mental models, and explainable AI decisions in collaborative scenarios.

research_groups.title: Design at Scale Lab (D@S Lab) – Hybrid Intelligence for Societal-Scale Design
research_groups.description: TU Delft AI Lab focused on large-scale participatory design through human-AI collaboration, crowd-AI systems, conversational agents, and hybrid intelligence for tackling complex societal challenges.

research_groups.title: Designing Intelligence Lab (DI_Lab)
research_groups.description: TU Delft AI Lab researching co-creative human-AI systems, multimodal dialogue interfaces, hybrid intelligence agents, design toolkits, and socially-aware AI for collaborative creativity.

research_groups.title: Interactive Intelligence Group
research_groups.description: Core research on human-agent interaction, hybrid/socio-cognitive intelligence, value-aligned AI, negotiation agents, collective decision-making, affective computing elements, and long-term human-AI collaboration.

research_groups.title: Web Information Systems (WIS) Group – Human-Centered AI & User Modeling
research_groups.description: Focuses on human-centered web data systems, user modeling, personalization, recommender systems, explainable AI, crowd computing, and human-in-the-loop AI.

research_groups.title: Cognitive Robotics Department / Delft Haptics Lab
research_groups.description: Research on physical and social human-robot interaction, haptics, shared control, sensorimotor learning, personalized robot adaptation, and human-aware robotic cognition.

research_groups.title: Human-Robot Interaction Lab (Design for Interaction)
research_groups.description: Designs robot behaviors and embodiment with a relational, situated approach to human-robot interaction and social co-existence; complements Cognitive Robotics by focusing on design, social interaction, and user experience.

research_groups.title: AI Futures Lab
research_groups.description: TU Delft AI Lab dedicated to responsible, justice-oriented human-AI interaction, participatory design, relational prototyping, and socio-technical approaches to rights-aligned AI systems.

research_groups.title: Human-Centred AI Network
research_groups.description: Network of TU Delft researchers across faculties working on trust, explainability, human-AI collaboration, user modeling, and adaptive systems. Provides coordination and visibility for interdisciplinary human-centered AI research.

research_groups.title: Socially Intelligent Artificial Systems (SIAS) Group
research_groups.description: Civic-centered, community-minded AI to reduce inequality and promote social good; inclusive socially-aware systems across education, health, mobility, and well-being, emphasizing value alignment, trust, and participatory design.

research_groups.title: Digital Interactions Lab (DIL)
research_groups.description: Human-computer interaction research bridging AI, sensors, smart environments, learning and health sciences; emphasizes human values, trust, agency, ethics, well-being, and human-centered augmentation.

research_groups.title: Information Retrieval Lab (IRLab)
research_groups.description: Research on conversational search, recommender systems, personalization, session-based recommendation, bias & fairness, and human-centered evaluation of retrieval and recommendation algorithms.

research_groups.title: Civic AI Lab (ICAI)
research_groups.description: Applied AI for the public good addressing societal inequality (education, health, mobility, welfare) through participatory, socially responsible, and value-aligned models in collaboration with city and government partners.

research_groups.title: OpenGov-AI Lab (ICAI)
research_groups.description: AI for transparent and accessible open government data; uses retrieval, NLP, generative methods, and explainability to enhance civic engagement and trust.

research_groups.title: HAVA-Lab – Human-Aligned Video-AI
research_groups.description: Interdisciplinary lab developing video-AI systems aligned with human values; integrates technical, cognitive, ethical, legal, and societal perspectives; focuses on computable human alignment and societal acceptance.

research_groups.title: Video & Image Sense Lab (VIS Lab) – incl. HAVA-Lab

research_groups.title: Dialogue Modelling & Language and Computation Group (ILLC)

research_groups.title: Digital Interaction Group (CREATE)

research_groups.title: Social Robotics Lab

research_groups.title: e/MTIC AI-Lab (ICAI Health-focused)

research_groups.title: Future Everyday Group (Industrial Design)

research_groups.title: Electronic Systems Group – Human-Centered & Physiological Computing

research_groups.title: Center for Humans and Technology
research_groups.description: Overarching center integrating HTI, philosophy of AI, systemic change, and persuasive/social robotics for ethical, human-centered technology design and societal impact.

research_groups.title: Human-Centred Computing Group

research_groups.title: Social and Affective Computing Group

research_groups.title: Social & Cognitive AI (SCAI) SIG

research_groups.title: Applied Human-Centered AI SIG

research_groups.title: Responsible AI Group

research_groups.title: AI & Mobility Lab

research_groups.title: AI Lab for Healthy Living

research_groups.title: National Police Lab AI (NPAI)

research_groups.title: AI & Media Lab

research_groups.title: AI in Education Lab
research_groups.description: Adaptive and personalized learning systems: AI-driven tutoring, educational recommender systems, and value-aligned assessment tools.

research_groups.title: Human Media Interaction (HMI) Group
research_groups.description: Leading group in multimodal human-computer interaction, social robotics, affective computing, brain-computer interfaces, virtual agents, conversational AI, social signal processing, and human behavior modeling.

research_groups.title: NeXAI – Next-generation Explainable & Trustworthy AI
research_groups.description: Faculty research cluster uniting HMI, Data Management & Biometrics, and Semantics/Cybersecurity/Services groups to develop safe, explainable, responsible, and human-centered AI systems.

research_groups.title: Persuasive Health Technology Lab (Psychology, Health & Technology)

research_groups.title: Centre for Monitoring & Coaching (Personalized eHealth Technology Programme)

research_groups.title: DesignLab
research_groups.description: Transdisciplinary platform for human-centered design, responsible innovation, co-creation with society, and exploring human-AI collaboration for societal challenges.

research_groups.title: Digital Society Institute (DSI)
research_groups.description: University-wide institute advancing human-centered digitalization in AI, data science, eHealth, robotics, and cybersecurity with strong societal and ethical integration.

research_groups.title: Social AI Lab – Prof. Koen Hindriks
research_groups.description: Develops socially intelligent agents and robots: personalized long-term human-robot interaction, child-robot companionship, theory-of-mind modeling, affective computing, value alignment, trust, and adaptive social behavior.

research_groups.title: User-Centric Data Science (UCDS) Group

research_groups.title: Hybrid Intelligence Centre (National Gravitation Programme, VU-led)

research_groups.title: AI & Behaviour Group

research_groups.title: Knowledge Representation & Reasoning (KRR) Group
research_groups.description: Neuro-symbolic AI, knowledge graphs, commonsense reasoning, explainable AI, and hybrid intelligence systems supporting human-AI collaboration.

research_groups.title: Civic AI Lab (ICAI, joint with UvA & City of Amsterdam)

research_groups.title: Cultural AI Lab

research_groups.title: Donders Institute – Social Interaction Lab
research_groups.description: Research on social human-AI and human-robot interaction, joint action, theory-of-mind modeling, affective computing, personalized adaptive agents, and neurophysiological correlates of interaction.

research_groups.title: Department of Artificial Intelligence – Human-AI Collaboration
research_groups.description: Interactive machine learning, human-in-the-loop AI, explainable AI, preference learning, personalization, and collaborative intelligent systems.

research_groups.title: ELLIS Unit Nijmegen
research_groups.description: Fundamental machine learning research with brain-inspired and neuromorphic computing, causal discovery, vision/language modeling, and strong ties to neuroscience.

research_groups.title: ICAI Lab – Radboud AI for Health
research_groups.description: Clinical AI research including predictive modeling, medical imaging, patient-centric decision support, and translational healthcare applications in collaboration with Radboudumc.

research_groups.title: ICAI Lab – AI for Precision Health, Nutrition & Behaviour
research_groups.description: Personalized AI interventions for lifestyle, nutrition, and behavior using sensor data, predictive modeling, and tailored behavioral coaching.

research_groups.title: Donders AI for Neurotech Lab (ICAI)

research_groups.title: Meaningful Human Control of AI / SIAC
research_groups.description: Philosophical, ethical, and societal research on value-sensitive AI design, human agency, responsibility, and democratic governance of AI and neurotechnology.

research_groups.title: National Education Lab AI (NOLAI)
research_groups.description: Co-creative, value-sensitive AI for education: adaptive learning systems, personalized feedback, and ethical educational technology in collaboration with teachers and schools.

research_groups.title: iHub – Interdisciplinary Hub for Digitalization and Society
research_groups.description: Responsible human-centered AI, participatory design, algorithmic fairness, personalization, and societal impact across domains.

research_groups.title: Human-AI Cluster (LIACS)

research_groups.title: Game Research Lab (GRL)

research_groups.title: Automated Design of Algorithms (ADA) Group

research_groups.title: Leiden Centre for Digital Humanities – AI Lab

research_groups.title: Information Technology Group – Human-Centred Socio-Technical Systems

research_groups.title: Wageningen Data Competence Center (WDCC)

research_groups.title: HUMAN-AI Alliance (EWUU consortium with strong WUR participation)

research_groups.title: Multi-Agent Systems (MAS) Group

research_groups.title: MINDS – Adaptive Perceptive Systems

research_groups.title: Center for Cognitive Systems and Materials (CogniGron)

research_groups.title: Intelligent Systems Group (Bernoulli Institute)

research_groups.title: Affective & Visual Computing Lab (AVCL)

research_groups.title: Explainable AI Group (DACS, Prof. Nava Tintarev)

research_groups.title: Brightlands Institute for Smart Society (BISS)

research_groups.title: Immersive Xperience Lab (IX Lab)

research_groups.title: Feminist Generative AI Lab
research_groups.description: Critical research on generative AI through feminist principles: inclusion, equity, power dynamics, participatory design, and socially just AI systems.

research_groups.title: Future Library Lab (University Library)
research_groups.description: Applies generative AI and NLP to academic workflows: AI-assisted literature analysis, metadata generation, research support tools, and responsible scholarly AI use.

research_groups.title: Division of Robotics, Perception & Learning (RPL)

research_groups.title: Division of Speech, Music & Hearing (TMH)

research_groups.title: Division of Media Technology & Interaction Design (MID)
research_groups.description: HCI and interaction design, embodied/tangible interaction, human-centred AI, creative AI tools, technology-enhanced learning, and personalization in media.

research_groups.title: Digital Futures – Human-Centered AI
research_groups.description: Interdisciplinary research on trustworthy and explainable AI, human-AI teaming, adaptive agents, value alignment, and responsible digitalisation. Digital Futures is a large cross-disciplinary centre. :contentReference[oaicite:0]{index=0}

research_groups.title: WASP-HS – Humanity & Society (KTH Participation)
research_groups.description: National, interdisciplinary program on the ethical, societal, and human-centered aspects of AI. WASP-HS funds projects on human-AI collaboration, value alignment, and the social impact of autonomous systems. :contentReference[oaicite:1]{index=1}

research_groups.title: Intelligence Augmentation Lab (IA-Lab, TMH / RPL)
research_groups.description: Smart-home living-lab environment for human–machine symbiosis: the lab includes a kitchen, sensors, cameras, and robots; used for experiments with assistive AI and cooking tasks. :contentReference[oaicite:2]{index=2}

research_groups.title: Advanced Adaptive Intelligent Systems (Digital Futures Project)

research_groups.title: Neuroscience of Engagement (Digital Futures Project)
research_groups.description: Multimodal research to model human engagement in HRI, using a combination of neural, audio-visual, and behavioural data to build socially adaptive robotic agents. :contentReference[oaicite:3]{index=3}

research_groups.title: XPRES – Smart People Focus Area (Digital Futures)

research_groups.title: Computational Science & Technology (CST) – Human & Brain Modelling
research_groups.description: Modelling of neural and biological systems, cognitive computing, and brain-inspired AI through mathematical modelling, ML, and simulation to support human-aware AI.

research_groups.title: Computer Vision Group (CVAP)
research_groups.description: Human-centric computer vision research: wearable vision, human pose estimation, behavior recognition, and assistive vision systems integrated with intelligent robotics.

KTH Royal Institute of Technology.notes_on_merge_and_fact_check: Coordinates correspond to KTH’s main campus (Valhallavägen). All listed groups are currently active and have verified web presences. IA-Lab is confirmed as a smart-home living lab under TMH / RPL. WASP-HS is a national program with KTH participation in human-centred AI research. Digital Futures is KTH’s main cross-disciplinary research hub and includes many human-AI teams. There is no major standalone recommender systems lab; personalization is integrated into robotics, interaction, and assistive systems.

research_groups.title: Kuggen Medialab (Interaction Design Lab)

research_groups.title: Humanities Lab – Cognitive Robotics & Interaction Group

research_groups.title: WASP-HS Lund Node – Humanity and Society

research_groups.title: eHealth@LU – Human-Centered Digital Health

research_groups.title: AI and Society (Dept. of Technology & Society / LTH)

research_groups.title: Human‑Machine Interaction (HMI) / Människa‑Maskin‑Interaktion
research_groups.description: Studies the interplay between humans and machines (automation, robots, intelligent interfaces), including social robotics, user-centred technology development, workplace UX, ethics, and sustainability.

research_groups.title: Cyber‑Physical Systems Lab (CPS Lab)
research_groups.description: Interdisciplinary research on connected physical systems: autonomous robots, smart automation, human-aware control, transparency, and system sustainability.

research_groups.title: Uppsala Social Robotics Lab
research_groups.description: Social human-robot interaction, personalized long-term companionship, affective computing, theory-of-mind modeling, and multimodal interaction with applications in education, healthcare, and assistive technology.

research_groups.title: Human-Computer Interaction Group
research_groups.description: Critical and feminist perspectives on ICT, human-centered design, everyday interaction with digital/AI systems, and embodied experiences.

research_groups.title: Trustworthy AI Research Arena
research_groups.description: Human-centered trustworthy AI research including explainability, fairness, human-AI collaboration, and societal implications.

research_groups.title: WASP-HS Uppsala Node / Projects
research_groups.description: Ethical and human-centered AI research as part of the national WASP-HS program, focusing on value alignment, societal impact, and human-AI collaboration.

research_groups.title: CAiM – Computer-assisted Applications in Medicine
research_groups.description: Applies machine learning, pattern recognition, and explainable AI to medical data for clinical decision support and diagnostics.

research_groups.title: MIDA – Methods for Image Data Analysis
research_groups.description: Develops ML and AI methods for interpretable image analysis, pattern recognition, and applications in medical and biological imaging.

research_groups.title: Optimisation Research Group
research_groups.description: Research on optimization algorithms, constraint programming, local search, and AI methods for decision-making and system design.

research_groups.title: Model Learning Group
research_groups.description: Automatic generation of behavioral models for software and cyber-physical systems using active learning and black-box testing.

research_groups.title: Uppsala Learning, Inference, and Optimisation Lab (LIO)
research_groups.description: Research on learning algorithms, probabilistic inference, optimization methods, and human-aware AI applications.

research_groups.title: Uppsala Secure Learning & Control Laboratory
research_groups.description: Integrates secure and privacy-aware learning with control theory to design trustworthy and reliable AI systems.

research_groups.title: UppsalaVLL – Vision, Language & Learning Group
research_groups.description: Research combining computer vision, language modelling, and machine learning for human-centered perceptual AI.

research_groups.title: Human Technology & Organisation Research Group (HTO)
research_groups.description: Studies human–technology interaction including cognition, sociotechnical aspects, trust, ethics, and user-centered design of intelligent systems.

research_groups.title: Worlds of Artificial Intelligence (Worlds of AI)
research_groups.description: Multidisciplinary platform exploring algorithmic, societal, institutional, and interactional aspects of AI, including embodied learning and AI values.

research_groups.title: Human–AI Communication Node
research_groups.description: Studies communication between humans and AI agents, including dialogue systems and social embedding of AI.

research_groups.title: AI Design Futures (Hub for Digital Existence)
research_groups.description: Interdisciplinary project examining existential, normative, and institutional future imaginaries of AI.

research_groups.title: CDHU AI Lab (Digital Humanities / Social Sciences)
research_groups.description: AI research in humanities and social sciences: NLP, computer vision, OCR, generative models, and societal embedding of AI.

research_groups.title: AI Design Futures: Digital Work & Robotisation (PhD / Projects)
research_groups.description: Research on AI-mediated future work environments, human-robot collaboration, empathy, and agency in digitalised workplaces.

research_groups.title: AI4Research (Strategic AI initiative)
research_groups.description: University-wide initiative strengthening interdisciplinary AI/ML research across sciences, medicine, humanities, and social sciences.

research_groups.title: XRIA Lab (Extended Reality & AI)
research_groups.description: Lab integrating AI and extended reality to build digital twin simulations, decision-support systems, and interactive immersive environments.

research_groups.title: Robotics and AI
research_groups.description: Focuses on bringing robotics into people’s everyday life, bridging advanced theory and real‑world applications (incl. autonomous aerial/ground vehicles, inspection of infrastructure, biomimetic robots) with human‑robot interaction and human‑AI collaboration.

research_groups.title: Information Systems – Human‑Centred Innovation & AI
research_groups.description: Research on human‑centred (responsible) innovation and design, focusing on digital transformation, human–technology interaction, data science and AI architecture within humans, organizations, and society.

research_groups.title: Machine Learning Group (Applied AI Innovation Hub)
research_groups.description: Fundamental and application‑oriented research in machine learning and AI including deep learning, pattern recognition, human‑computer interaction, with applications in Industry 4.0, education, and trustworthy AI systems.

research_groups.title: Pervasive and Mobile Computing – Human‑Centered AI (ArcTech Learning Lab)
research_groups.description: Human-centered AI in pervasive environments: multimodal learning, avatars, educational simulations, context-aware personalization, and collaboration in industrial and Arctic settings.

research_groups.title: AI‑Human Collaboration for Improved Situation Awareness (Project)
research_groups.description: Investigates how humans and intelligent systems can collaborate to maintain situational awareness in safety‑critical maintenance domains, emphasizing human-in-the-loop decision support and augmented reality.

research_groups.title: Human-Centered Artificial Intelligence Cluster (HCAI@GU)
research_groups.description: Interdisciplinary cluster on human-centered, participatory, and responsible AI; focuses on societal impact, value-sensitive design, human-AI interaction in organizations and everyday life.

research_groups.title: Division of Human-Computer Interaction (Applied IT)
research_groups.description: Leading Scandinavian group in participatory and critical HCI; human-centered design of digital/AI systems, sustainable technology use, embodied interaction, and socio-technical implications.

research_groups.title: Centre for Linguistic Theory and Studies in Probability (CLASP)
research_groups.description: Computational linguistics, logic, and cognitive modeling; bridges NLP, AI, cognitive science, and robotics with focus on dialogue, reasoning, and human-like language understanding.

research_groups.title: CLASP – Cognitive Systems Group
research_groups.description: Formal and distributional models of meaning, situated agents, multimodal communication, dialogue systems, and cognitive modeling of language interacting with perception and action.

research_groups.title: CLASP – ML, Cognitive Modeling & NLP Group
research_groups.description: Bridges machine learning, cognitive modeling, and NLP; develops data-driven yet cognitively plausible models using human-collected data and psycholinguistic experiments.

research_groups.title: AI and Law Research Group
research_groups.description: Interdisciplinary research on legal, ethical, and governance implications of AI; algorithmic accountability, regulation, and human rights in digital systems.

research_groups.title: WASP-HS Gothenburg Node – Humanity and Society
research_groups.description: National programme projects on ethical, social, and human-centered AI; Gothenburg contributions include value alignment, human-AI collaboration, and societal transformation.

research_groups.title: DICE Lab (Digitalisation, Interaction, Cognition, Emotion)
research_groups.description: Studies interaction using AI and cognitive methods in social, clinical, and applied settings; includes human-robot interaction, affective computing, driving behavior, and engagement with digital interventions.

research_groups.title: Cognition & Communication Research (Applied IT)
research_groups.description: Interdisciplinary research on human cognition, communication, and interaction with automated systems, including affective computing in social robots and human-automated interaction in organizations.

research_groups.title: Humanistic AI (GRIDH)
research_groups.description: From the humanities perspective: investigating AI’s impact on culture, meaning, language, ethics, and society; develops frameworks for human-centered, value-based AI in digital humanities.

research_groups.title: AI Engineering Lab (GU & Chalmers)
research_groups.description: Joint lab focusing on engineering, architecture, testing, and deployment of AI systems in practice, including software engineering, system pipelines, and HCI considerations.

research_groups.title: AI & Software Engineering (CSE, Chalmers)
research_groups.description: Research on software architectures for AI: testing, requirement engineering, data pipelines, conversational AI, and generative language models in socio-technical contexts.

research_groups.title: Interaction Design & Human-Robot Interaction (Course/Research)
research_groups.description: Research and education in human-robot interaction, interaction design, and how humans and autonomous agents (robots) communicate, collaborate, and share tasks.

research_groups.title: Language, Dialogue & Trust in AI
research_groups.description: Research on dialogue systems, trust, user modeling; studies how humans understand, trust, and collaborate with AI agents.

research_groups.title: Social Robotics Lab (Psychology)
research_groups.description: Social human-robot interaction, personalized long-term companionship, affective computing, theory-of-mind modeling, multimodal child-robot interaction.

research_groups.title: Human-Computer Interaction Group (dSV)
research_groups.description: Participatory and critical HCI, sustainable interaction design, everyday use of digital/AI technologies, embodied and social contexts of computing.

research_groups.title: Stockholm Technology & Interaction Research (STIR)
research_groups.description: Interdisciplinary HCI research on digital health, voice interaction, mobility, ethics of autonomous systems, and AI in everyday life.

research_groups.title: Clinical Psychology – Digital Mental Health
research_groups.description: Affective computing and personalized digital interventions for mental health and psychological well-being.

research_groups.title: Learning Analytics and AI for Education (dSV)
research_groups.description: AI-supported adaptive and personalized learning systems; research on human-centered learning technologies, modeling learning behavior, and designing intelligent educational environments.

research_groups.title: WASP-HS Stockholm University Projects
research_groups.description: Ethical and human-centered AI, value alignment, societal impact, and human-AI collaboration; part of the national WASP-HS program.

research_groups.title: Intelligent Systems Group – Human-Centered AI
research_groups.description: Human-AI interaction, explainable AI, interactive machine learning, personalization, collaborative AI, with applications in health and software engineering.

research_groups.title: Visualization and Interaction Research Group (VIS)
research_groups.description: Human-centered visual analytics, interactive ML interfaces, personalization in data exploration, and collaborative visualization.

research_groups.title: Digital Health and Human-Centered Computing Lab
research_groups.description: Personalized eHealth/mHealth systems, affective computing for mental health, behavior change support technologies, and human-centered AI in digital therapeutics.

research_groups.title: TAIGA – Centre for Transdisciplinary AI
research_groups.description: Cross-faculty centre for human-centered AI research in health, education, society, ethical/legal/social AI, embodied interactive AI, and explainability.

research_groups.title: AI for Data Management
research_groups.description: Knowledge representation, reasoning, ontology-based data access, personalized data access, and semantic frameworks for robust data systems.

research_groups.title: Human-Centered AI for Health, Autonomy & Well-Being
research_groups.description: Participatory data-driven tools in health contexts, emphasizing design methods, inclusivity, user agency, and well-being.

research_groups.title: Art & AI Working Group (UmArts)
research_groups.description: Explores intersections of art, ethics, and AI through design, curation, and critical media practice.

research_groups.title: Trustworthy Group Robotics (Human-Robot Interaction)
research_groups.description: Multi-robot systems interacting with humans, explainable behavior, and communication of robot plans.

research_groups.title: Socially Aware AI
research_groups.description: Computational models of social concepts to enable AI agents to act appropriately in human social contexts, including chatbots and social robotics.

research_groups.title: Interactive and Intelligent Systems – Collaborative AI Lab
research_groups.description: Designing human–agent cooperation systems, user modeling, adaptation & personalization, intelligent health support, and socially intelligent agents.

research_groups.title: Responsible Artificial Intelligence
research_groups.description: Ethical, legal, and societal impacts of AI; building and governing AI systems aligned with human values, trust, explainability, and regulation.

research_groups.title: AI @ UmU (AI Competence at Umeå)
research_groups.description: Umbrella for AI activities at Umeå University, spanning research, education, societal engagement, and industrial collaboration.

research_groups.title: HUMlab – Digital Humanities & Human-Machine Interaction
research_groups.description: Research on digital practice, hybrid environments, interactive media, and social/cultural dimensions of intelligent systems in digital humanities.

research_groups.title: AI Policy Lab
research_groups.description: Interdisciplinary research on AI governance, policy frameworks, human-in-the-loop systems, and trustworthy human-centered AI regulation.

research_groups.title: Centre for Psychiatry Research – Digital Psychiatry Group
research_groups.description: Human-centered digital mental health, personalized eHealth interventions, behavior change support, and AI in psychiatric care.

research_groups.title: Clinical Neuroscience – Affective Computing & Neuroinformatics
research_groups.description: Affective computing using neuroimaging/physiology, emotion recognition, computational psychiatry, and personalized mental health AI.

research_groups.title: Health Informatics Centre (HIC) – Patient-Centered AI
research_groups.description: Patient modeling, personalized medicine, human-centered clinical AI, and explainable health informatics.

research_groups.title: Centre for AI Innovation
research_groups.description: Institute-wide hub promoting development, translation, and deployment of trustworthy AI in healthcare, bridging research, clinical validation, and education.

research_groups.title: Trustworthy & Ethical AI Lab (TEA Lab)
research_groups.description: Interdisciplinary lab for ethical, transparent, human-centered AI in medical decision-making, aligned with EU Trustworthy AI principles.

research_groups.title: Predictive Medicine – Mattias Rantalainen’s Research Group
research_groups.description: Machine learning and AI for precision medicine and computational pathology using large-scale biomedical and imaging data.

research_groups.title: Social and Affective Learning and Decision-Making (Emotion Lab)
research_groups.description: Computational, neural, and behavioral research on social and affective learning and human decision-making.

research_groups.title: Medical Sensors & Diagnostics – Team Onur Parlak
research_groups.description: AI and sensor-based diagnostics, including medical imaging, sensor integration, and early detection systems.

research_groups.title: CAIR-Lab (Clinical Artificial Intelligence Research Laboratory)
research_groups.description: Clinical AI lab developing and validating AI for diagnostics, medical imaging, and CE-marked clinical tools in collaboration with hospitals.

research_groups.title: SMAILE (Stockholm Medical AI & Learning Environments)
research_groups.description: AI infrastructure and core facility for digital health research: regulatory guidance, training, and cross-disciplinary AI applications in medicine.

research_groups.title: I-AID (Integrated AI Diagnostics)
research_groups.description: Regional innovation embedding AI decision-support into clinical workflows, developing infrastructure, processes, and algorithms for AI-assisted diagnostics.

research_groups.title: WASP-HS Karolinska Node
research_groups.description: Ethical human-centered AI in medicine, value alignment, and human-AI collaboration.
